match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: England won by 10 wickets (with 145 balls remaining) (D/L method)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of England and Scotland
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of England and Scotland

image.caption: A general view of Trent Bridge during the fourth Test
image.longCaption: A general view of Trent Bridge during the fourth Test, England v Australia, Trent Bridge, August 25, 2005

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Morgan b Dernbach 75 (107b 7x4 0x6 173m) SR: 70.09

dismissalComment.html: there's the wicket! Sangakkara swings across the line and a leading edge loops up on the off side ... Morgan gets himself underneath it at backward point and takes the catch to end the innings

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c & b Bresnan 39 (49b 1x4 2x6 60m) SR: 79.59

dismissalComment.html: great work from Bresnan! Key breakthrough! Short ball reared up and took the shoulder of Mathews' bat as he tried to turn it to leg, it looped back towards the bowler who ran in, dived and snaffled it with one-hand inches off the turf. Mathews demanded the third umpire took a second look but that only confirmed how good a catch it was
gone! Dilshan departs for a duck! Anderson pitched it up, the late swing found the edge and Kieswetter took the chance

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Chandimal over this time! Don't play England when the ball nips around! He was only half-forward when an inswinger clipped his front pad around the knee roll on off stump. Century followed by a duck for the 21-year-old
all over for Kandamby! Didn't need to play it but was drawn into a little fence outside off with an open face, ended up guiding it to slip

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full, straight, Kulasekara is struck plumb in front and it's an easy decision for umpire Illingworth. Hmm, in fact replays suggest that wasn't as close as it looked at first, just clipping leg
the middle stump is knocked out of the ground! Malinga backed to leg and swished at a full toss aimed at the base of middle, missing completely. Another wicket for Dernbach, and isn't he happy
there's the wicket! Sangakkara swings across the line and a leading edge loops up on the off side ... Morgan gets himself underneath it at backward point and takes the catch to end the innings

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c †Kieswetter b Anderson 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! Dilshan departs for a duck! Anderson pitched it up, the late swing found the edge and Kieswetter took the chance

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonathan Trott player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Trott b Bresnan 9 (12b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: big wicket! Jayawardene falls and he'll be disappointed with the shot. Just flirted at an away swinger outside off, could easily have left it but ended up edging to slip

dismissalComment.html: Chandimal over this time! Don't play England when the ball nips around! He was only half-forward when an inswinger clipped his front pad around the knee roll on off stump. Century followed by a duck for the 21-year-old

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Swann player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thilina Kandamby c Swann b Anderson 6 (15b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: all over for Kandamby! Didn't need to play it but was drawn into a little fence outside off with an open face, ended up guiding it to slip

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv c †Kieswetter b Broad 18 (27b 4x4 0x6 29m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: sweet relief! Randiv gloves a lifter down the leg side, and Broad's wait is over. It wasn't the most impressive piece of bowling ever seen, but he'll take a wicket any way he can get it. To his credit, he also immediately turned to appeal to the umpire as the ball landed in Kieswetter's gloves. He's smiling now

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c & b Bresnan 39 (49b 1x4 2x6 60m) SR: 79.59

dismissalComment.html: great work from Bresnan! Key breakthrough! Short ball reared up and took the shoulder of Mathews' bat as he tried to turn it to leg, it looped back towards the bowler who ran in, dived and snaffled it with one-hand inches off the turf. Mathews demanded the third umpire took a second look but that only confirmed how good a catch it was

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis c †Kieswetter b Broad 11 (29b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 37.93

dismissalComment.html: Broad gets another and Kieswetter will be thrilled! Tough chance as Mendis slashed at a short ball, top edge flew through but Kieswetter jumped at just the right moment to cling on. Broad's luck must be changing because he has two wickets with two pretty ordinary deliveries today

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Kieswetter glances a low full-toss to square leg, where the fielder dives but can only parry it and allow the batsmen to sprint through and complete a crushing win

commentPostTextItems.html: England level the series 2-2 with a resounding 10-wicket win. The limited-overs leg of this tour really has swung back and forth. Sri Lanka breezed through the Bristol Twenty20, and then crashed and burned at The Oval. They came back to inflict a heavy defeat at Headingley, and then took the lead with a comfortable win at Lord's. And now England have levelled the series by easing to a 10-wicket hammering. What will Old Trafford provide? Stick with us for the presentations, and to find out who the Man of the Match is.

"We lost so many wickets in the first few overs," says losing captain Tillakaratne Dilshan. "230 to 240 would've been a good total. England batted really well in the second half, there was no pressure with such a small total. If we get runs on the board, we can win the next match and the series. England bowled really well in the conditions today, especially Anderson. If we can bat through the first 10 without losing wickets we can set a good score. Cook has played good cricket, but i'm thinking of my own game."

"It was outstanding, from the moment we won the toss, bowled, put Sri Lanka under pressure - wickets always help that - and then knocked off the runs without losing any wickets," says Alastair Cook. "It was a good wicket, it didn't do as much as we thought it did. I honestly don't think it moved that much, although thank you to the groundsman for leaving grass on the pitch, which is what we asked for. Craig [Kieswetter] and I proved it was a very good wicket, but home advantage is there in all sports, and you can use it."

Cook is also Man of the Match. 'Have you ever batted better in a one-day game than you did tonight?' asks Nasser Hussain. "Probably not, I don't always time the ball as nicely as that." 'Have you answered your critics?' "A couple of innings dont do that, I've got to prove that over a long period of times. [As captain there are] tough times and good times, when you win you enjoy it. I think it's important we've stayed unchanged [in the series], it shows we've got faith in our cricketers." He also answers the question as to whether Kieswetter will be dropped for not allowing him to reach a hundred with good humour, suggesting his interviewer knows it's the red inker that counts!

Read all about England's thumping win in Andrew Miller's bulletin, or if pictures are your thing, check out our match gallery. Be sure to check in a little later as well, when you'll find match analysis courtesy of Andrew McGlashan. Otherwise, goodbye from the whole team, and we'll see you again for the series-deciding final match at Old Trafford on Saturday.

commentTextItems.html: tapped to mid-off
what a strike! Real flamboyant stuff from Kieswetter, who comes down and smears the ball over midwicket, raising one leg off the ground as he does so
Kieswetter dances down and slams a length ball straight at the cover fielder. He's not playing for Cook's ton

commentPreTextItems.html: Both opening bowlers come back on, here's Kulasekara.

commentTextItems.html: Cook steps right across to off, exposing leg and middle stumps, and clips a low full toss out to deep square ... just the single
another perfect blockhole delivery, and Kieswetter does well just to keep that away from his stumps

commentPostTextItems.html: So, Cook still has a chance! He wants 6, England need 8.

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full, straight and fast. Kieswetter jams the ball to mid-on

commentPreTextItems.html: Cook has a quick chat with Kieswetter - telling him not to worry about the landmark?

commentTextItems.html: Malinga digs in a bouncer, but it's a fairly toothless one and Kieswetter ducks underneath it easily
dug out to cover for one more
another very full ball, though this one is wide of off and Cook drives over the top of it

commentPreTextItems.html: 9 for the win, 7 for the ton ... and Malinga is brought back for a final burst, though it's all a bit pointless now.

commentTextItems.html: no warm-up ball for Malinga, he just sprints in and delivers a perfect yorker, well kept out by Cook
muscled out to deep midwicket, there's balance and power in the shot, and placement too. Shades of Shane Watson ...

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: chopped to backward point, there's no single to be had
heaved straight back over the bowlers head! Kieswetter opened up his stance and just swung his arms cleanly through the line
driven down to long-on with plenty of bottom hand
swept down to fine leg, where a sliding stop saves the boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: "Best thing here would be for kieswetter to get out, trott come out and play his natural game...surely cook would get his hundred then." So says Arsalan Qadir.

commentTextItems.html: this wasn't all that short, but Cook picked up the length really quickly and smashed a pull out to deep midwicket. He's into the 90s now!
tapped quietly back to the bowler to end the over

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Kieswetter lunges forward to smother another flighted delivery outside off
bounce and a hint of turn for Randiv, and Kieswetter is hit on the thigh as he attempts to work to leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Suraj Randiv player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suraj Randiv c †Kieswetter b Broad 18 (27b 4x4 0x6 29m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: sweet relief! Randiv gloves a lifter down the leg side, and Broad's wait is over. It wasn't the most impressive piece of bowling ever seen, but he'll take a wicket any way he can get it. To his credit, he also immediately turned to appeal to the umpire as the ball landed in Kieswetter's gloves. He's smiling now

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Bresnan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c & b Bresnan 39 (49b 1x4 2x6 60m) SR: 79.59

dismissalComment.html: great work from Bresnan! Key breakthrough! Short ball reared up and took the shoulder of Mathews' bat as he tried to turn it to leg, it looped back towards the bowler who ran in, dived and snaffled it with one-hand inches off the turf. Mathews demanded the third umpire took a second look but that only confirmed how good a catch it was

dismissalText.commentary: Jeevan Mendis c †Kieswetter b Broad 11 (29b 1x4 0x6 31m) SR: 37.93

dismissalComment.html: Broad gets another and Kieswetter will be thrilled! Tough chance as Mendis slashed at a short ball, top edge flew through but Kieswetter jumped at just the right moment to cling on. Broad's luck must be changing because he has two wickets with two pretty ordinary deliveries today

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara lbw b Dernbach 5 (7b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: full, straight, Kulasekara is struck plumb in front and it's an easy decision for umpire Illingworth. Hmm, in fact replays suggest that wasn't as close as it looked at first, just clipping leg

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Dernbach 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: the middle stump is knocked out of the ground! Malinga backed to leg and swished at a full toss aimed at the base of middle, missing completely. Another wicket for Dernbach, and isn't he happy

headshotImage.caption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jade Dernbach player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Morgan b Dernbach 75 (107b 7x4 0x6 173m) SR: 70.09

dismissalComment.html: there's the wicket! Sangakkara swings across the line and a leading edge loops up on the off side ... Morgan gets himself underneath it at backward point and takes the catch to end the innings

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook not out 95 (75b 16x4 0x6 104m) SR: 126.66
Craig Kieswetter not out 72 (68b 8x4 3x6 104m) SR: 105.88
